metadata.title: D3.3 - Transferring Innovation Best Practices
metadata.description:
The digiNEB.eu project successfully created a platform for transferring innovation best practices in support of the New European Bauhaus (NEB) initiative. Over its duration, the project showed that digital technologies can support the transition towards sustainable, inclusive, and aesthetically enriched living spaces, aligning with the European Green Deal's ambitions. Through a combination of mapping, stakeholder engagement, capacity-building, and knowledge dissemination, digiNEB.eu has delivered concrete results that have an impact across Europe. The key achievements of digiNEB are:

Mapping and Showcasing Digital Solutions and Projects

digiNEB.eu successfully mapped NEB-related projects and curated a Digital Toolkit comprising innovative digital solutions aligning with the NEB values. These tools and services provide stakeholders with practical, accessible resources to address NEB challenges. By combining innovations in the built environment into a comprehensive online toolkit of tools, projects and actors, digiNEB.eu connected research outcomes and real-world applications, empowering users to implement solutions that enhance sustainability, inclusivity, and aesthetic quality in European living environments.

Building a Pan-European Network

The project cultivated a vibrant, cross-disciplinary community of stakeholders, representing a diverse array of actors, including architects, designers, SMEs, policymakers, and civil society organisations.

This network has been instrumental in promoting the best practices identified by the project. Through the Technical Working Groups (TWGs) and the External Advisory Group (EAG), digiNEB.eu fostered meaningful collaboration and knowledge-sharing across sectors and guided the development of strategies for transferring innovative solutions to diverse contexts.

Capacity Building and Knowledge Transfer

digiNEB.eu successfully conducted 16 multi-stakeholder workshops and 6 webinars, bringing together professionals, innovators, educators and policy actors to exchange knowledge and explore best practices. These events facilitated learning, networking and the transfer of innovation across the NEB community. To facilitate knowledge transfer, digiNEB-eu set up an e-learning catalogue of online courses aligning with the NEB values. digiNEB cooperates with the development of an eLearning platform feeding the NEBA project facilitating the platform’s long-term sustainability. In this way, digiNEB leverages the knowledge of the digital ecosystem, the pan-European network and knowledge building towards creating a platform for capacity building.

Showcasing Best Practices

The project culminated in the open-access publication of Deliverable 3.3, a comprehensive resource that captures the transfer of innovation best practices throughout the project. This publication showcases the activities performed to strengthen the pan-European capacity building connecting regions, communities and actors through a multi-layered multi-stakeholder approach. These activities focused on collectively sharing innovations applied to real-world NEB challenges, offering replicable solutions for stakeholders across Europe. Events featured in the publication highlight concrete examples of innovative projects, tools and actors that have shown best practices in line with the NEB values.

Conclusion

The digiNEB.eu project has delivered significant and lasting contributions in transferring innovation best practices across Europe. By fostering a multi-layered, multi-stakeholder collaborative and crossdisciplinary network and providing access to tools, projects and actors that are successfully paving the way, digiNEB.eu has empowered stakeholders to actively engage with the NEB community. The project's outputs, from the Digital Toolkit, the online platform or the policy recommendations, ensure that digital innovation will continue to drive the transformation of European living spaces, making them more sustainable, inclusive, and beautiful for generations to come.

grants.title: Digital ecosystem for the New European Bauhaus initiative (DigiNEB)

metadata.title: Draft genome sequence of Alicyclobacillus acidocaldarius strain LH1 isolated from an Andean solfataric field
metadata.description:
Annotation data for assembly GCA_040779485.1 available in the GenBank database.

Annotation of assembly GCA_040779485.1 using the bioinformatics programs CRISPRCasFinder, mobileOG-db v1.1.3. and VirSorter v2.2.4. The results of the programs are made available through their output documents.

creators.name: Blamey, Jenny
creators.affiliation: Fundación Científica y Cultural Biociencia, Santiago, Chile

data.title: Draft genome sequence of Alicyclobacillus acidocaldarius strain LH1 isolated from an Andean solfataric field

metadata.description:
This is the ETL version used for Open Targets 25.03 release.

What's Changed

metadata.title: Festivals as Vehicle for Cultural Revival: An Appraisal of Madawa Cultural Festival
metadata.description:
Abstract: The infiltration of Western civilization into African societies has resulted in the loss of interest in the once-cherished African culture and tradition. Africans, especially the elites, have joined the so-called civilized world to see the pristine African tradition and culture as crude and barbaric following the Western education and civilization they have acquired. Furthermore, as a result of religions that were foreign to Africa which Africans have come to embrace, most African elites have dissociated themselves from certain traditional spiritual symbols and activities which are Indigenous to them. Festival, which is an annual event that celebrates an aspect of community, such as its tradition, art or religion has proven a strong medium of revamping the lost interest in African tradition, culture, and arts. The paper looks at how African tradition and culture are now being rebranded and passed to new generations at home and abroad through festivals with particular reference to the Madawa festival. Madawa festival is a special annual festival celebrated by the Gbagyi people of Bosso Local Government in Niger State. Madawa is commemorated mainly but not exclusively to neutralize any possible afflictions hunters may suffer as a result of the game they kill. The festival attracts people from all works of life, far and near. The paper argues that there is a renewed interest in African tradition and culture by both the traditionalists and elites as all strive to identify themselves with the tradition and culture of the people during a festival. Festivals have therefore sustained African tradition and culture thereby saving them from total extinction. The paper is therefore an attempt to examine festivals as the core channels and of course, the most vibrant medium that practically conveys African tradition and culture from one generation to another. The functionalist approach to literature will be adopted to appraise the Madawa Festival to establish the role of the festival as a medium of cultural revival. The paper recommends that rather than seeing festivals as a mere funfair they should be taken seriously. Any language or ethnic group that faces extinction of its tradition  and culture should consider organizing a festival of cultural revival.

Takaitawa: Shigar wayewar yemmacin duniya acikin al'umomin Africa ya haifar da asarar al'adunAfrica wanda a da ake alfahari dasu. YanAfrica, musamman masufadaaji, sun shiga cikin kasashen da ake kira duniya masu wayewa don ganin al'ada da al'adun Africa masu daraja a matsayin danyen aiki da dabanci biyo bayan ilimi da wayew yemmaci da suka samu. Bugu da kari, soboda zuwan adinan kasashenwaje zuwa Africa, yan bokon Africa sun raba kansu da wasu alamomi da al'amuran gargajiya wadanda aka saba dasu a garuruwansu. Wannan takarda ta yi dubi ne kan yadda ake sake fasalin al'adun Africa tare da isar da su ga yaran  zamani tare da yin la'akar da bikin madawa. Don haka wannantakarda kokarine na bincika biki ngargajiya a matsayin daya daga cikin hanyoyi da azahiri ake isar da al'adun Africa daga wannan tsara zuwa wancan. Takardar ta ba da shawara cewa duk wata kabila da ke fuskantar rugujewar al'adunta ta yi tunanin shirya bikin al'adun gargajiya.

data.title: Festivals as Vehicle for Cultural Revival: An Appraisal of Madawa Cultural Festival

metadata.title: Medical tourism and healthcare trends in Thailand
metadata.description: Medical tourism can be defined as the travel of patients from one country to another with the intention of receiving medical treatment. This is an increasing and important feature of modern-day healthcare. Indeed, these latter years have seen spectacular evolution in the relationship between the two fields, health and tourism, as they merge to offer unforgettable experiences for those needing medical attention abroad. This extended essay, therefore, attempts to give wide-ranging information about this marvelous phenomenon by de-mystifying the various characteristics and its very nature imbedded in the grand context of Thai society, which has emerged as a veritable hotbed for medical tourism. Thailand, with its rich cultural heritage and salubrious landscapes, has gradually carved a niche for itself as one of the leading destinations in the international medical tourism market. This is due to various key elements contributing to the success of this industry inside the country that make it an ideal destination when considering quality medical treatment. Probably one of the significant and most specified reasons behind Thailand's medical tourism is its unparalleled affordability, ensuring that patients throughout the world get the best possible medical services for a fraction of the cost they would have incurred if the same services were offered in their home countries. Additionally, the excellent quality of services that healthcare institutions in Thailand provide also forms a strong basis for patient attraction from far and wide. It includes institutions that uphold the best standards of care in medicine, have state-of-the-art technologies and treatment methodologies for the best results on patients, and have very effective marketing strategies that work towards enhancing their reach. Thus, they have gained global recognition for their excellence not only in medical services but also in patient care. The supportive government policy promotion of the medical tourism industry was also important in determining Thailand as a health travel destination. Unreserved support by the government and commitment to the industry ensured an enabling environment that saw health providers pass unparalleled services to international patients. Furthermore, the partnership developed by the government with private operators and other stakeholders has translated into lasting relationships that ensure further success of medical tourism in Thailand. Besides the good quality medical services, the attractions that Thailand is associated with as a tourist destination further add value to visiting by medical tourists. This could be the most exciting destination in Thailand, as it combines medical treatments with vacations for complete relaxation and rejuvenation. Everything-from beautiful beaches and natural wonders to vibrant cultural experiences-offers enough variety to complement medical tourists' overall journeys with experiences and memories. Most importantly, easy accessibility to Thailand acts as a strong contributing factor towards its recognition as a hub for medical tourism. This country has very well-connected international airports and proper transportation connectivity internally. Because of this, patients face no problems reaching their concerned medical facilities with ease. Seamless entry into Thailand further facilitates medical travel, ensuring the process is smooth and hassle-free for the patients right from the moment of arrival in the country. However, this is not the sole factor responsible for such a huge popularity of Thailand as a healthcare destination. It is the emerging new trends of this medical tourism industry that sustain this factor to a large extent. The country has been prompt enough in adopting these emerging trends to enhance infrastructure continuously and offer advance and specialized medical treatments with due regard to the requirements and expectations of the patients. This proactive approach enables Thailand to stay ahead in the race in the medical tourism industry while it goes on with continuous development and raising the standards. Furthermore, much reliance on word-of-mouth publicity is what contributes heavily to Thailand's continued success in the medical tourism sector. Patients who have had positive experiences in Thai health facilities are so eager to share their stories of experiences and recommendations and act as brand ambassadors for the country's superior medical services. It is this organic promotion that helps place Thailand in a strategic position in the global medical tourism market, with an ever-increasing influx of patients seeking top-notch healthcare across borders. The increased expectations of patients and the need to transition to more preventive and wellness services are clear for healthcare providers in Thailand. This, therefore, has made these providers reorient their services toward integrated and holistic care with a view of focusing on the immediate needs of the treatment but also the total well-being of the patient. The preventive healthcare measures, promotion of healthy lifestyles, and incorporation of wellness into their service offerings are all part of how Thai healthcare providers take a holistic, patient-centered approach to medical tourism. Service providers in the industrial competitive landscape of healthcare in Thailand continue to work out the challenge of maintaining high standards of quality and pursuing continuous improvement. Excellence in medical treatment and care for the patient with overall service provided must be abreast of all times in this fast-moving dynamic industry. Continuous development in services builds a niche that sets them apart from their competitors and cements their position as a favorite among medical tourists emanating from all parts of the world. This would, therefore, suggest that the developing phenomenon of medical tourism has established itself as a transformative force within healthcare, somewhat muddying the boundaries between health and tourism. Reasonably priced, superior quality of service, strategically marketed, liberal government policies, incomparable resort destinations, easy to reach, strong public-private partnership, new trends, friendly entry processes, world-class infrastructure, and above all, depending heavily on word-of-mouth advertising, Thailand has no doubt created a niche for itself as a leading global player in this medical tourism sector. The providers are clearly working their way up the ladder in providing comprehensive and patient-centered services, as they understand the shift in the expectations of patients from healthcare and the emphasis on preventive and wellness services. These providers are operating amid competitors, working further for excellence, setting higher standards of quality, and contributing to the continued success of medical tourism in Thailand.

journal.title: World Journal of Advanced Research and Reviews

data.title: Medical tourism and healthcare trends in Thailand

metadata.title: Top five honeymoon destinations for international travelers in Thailand
metadata.description: Thailand has been one of the most coveted honeymoon spots for newlywed couples from around the world for quite some time now. Be it its magnificent landscapes, enchanting culture, or warm hospitality-this Southeast Asian beauty never misses a chance to enthrall international travelers. The following represents an in-depth study in which we reveal the cream of honeymoon spots in Thailand, giving the reader an in-depth look at our top five picks bound to create lifelong memories. First on our list is the picturesque island of Phuket, really a tropical paradise found. With its pristine white-sand beaches, crystal-clear turquoise waters, and luxurious resorts, this destination merely sets the stage for a dream-like honeymoon experience. From snorkeling off its colorful coral reefs to going on a romantic sunset cruise, to simply relaxing with a rejuvenating beach couples' massage, couples can truly do almost anything in paradise. With great nightlife and excellent food to boot, Phuket is little short of a dream destination. Second on the list is the very beautiful Island of Koh Samui, boasting its ideal beauty and tranquil atmosphere. Here, honeymooners can have the ultimate fun in secluded beaches, high-class luxury resorts, and a harmonious balance of unspoiled nature and modern-day comfort. From walking hand in hand over the velvet softness of the sand to jet-skiing across wild waves, from a lazy afternoon nap on the hot sandy beach to dinner by candlelight under star-studded skies, Koh Samui is a place of idyllic romance that cossets couples as they celebrate their love. The far inland from any coastline, Chiang Mai offers the honeymooner a more culturally enriched experience. Tucked away among mist-shrouded mountains and lush landscapes, this northern city is bursting with history, spirituality, and natural beauty in one. They can walk around ancient temples, join traditional Thai cooking classes, or have once-in-a-lifetime elephant treks, or simply sit in a retreat in a traditional Thai spa. The city of Chiang Mai is considered a dreamland for couples seeking cultural immersion and serenity on their honeymoon. Krabi is another must-see destination for honeymooners traveling in Thailand, boasting awe-inspiring karst formations, turquoise waters, and thick mangroves. This paradisiacal coastline acts as an idyllic backdrop for romance and adventure. A couple can go on an island-hopping tour mesmerizing or trek into emerald jungles to discover hidden waterfalls deep inside, or they can simply go on a rock-climbing spree. With Krabi Natural Wonders and breathtaking vistas, it stands out as an ideal destination for couples who are looking for a well-balanced dose of relaxation and exploration. Finally, there is the city of Bangkok-a metropolis bustling with life that effortlessly melts modernity with tradition. This pulsating capital is sure to mesmerize newlywed couples with skyscrapers touching the sky, ornate temples, chaotic markets, and pulsating street life. From eating from street food vendors down to an immersive nightlife, experiences in Bangkok are simply unending. They would be able to cruise along the magnificent Chao Phraya River, get lost in the majesty of the Grand Palace, or even just take a romantic evening stroll through the charming old town. In fact, from the careful research and analysis we had conducted, Thailand turns out to be an enchanting honeymoon paradise that no couple can resist, for its perfect setting combines relaxation, recreation, and exploration. Be it the serenity of pristine beaches, an immersion in ancient cities, or the vibrant hum of a metropolis, these are the top honeymoon destinations in Thailand that create an unforgettable experience that will be etched into the hearts of couples as they begin their journey of love.

journal.title: World Journal of Advanced Research and Reviews

data.title: Top five honeymoon destinations for international travelers in Thailand
